column1: Panguipulli ( PANG-gee-POO-yee; Mapudungun for "hill of the puma") is a city and commune in Valdivia Province
column3: administered by the Municipality of Panguipulli. The town is known for its natural environment
column4: and is called "City of roses" (Spanish: La Ciudad de las rosas). Panguipulli is located on the western edge of Panguipulli Lake
column5: and is on a moraine in the Chilean Central Valley. Most of the commune lies on Andean mountains and valleys.

column1: Panguipulli's first recorded inhabitants were indigenous Mapuches that lived along the shores of the main lakes and rivers of the region. The first mention of Panguipulli was in 1776. Guillermo Angermaier
column2: who settled in the western shores of Panguipulli Lake in 1885
column3: was the first non-indigenous person to settle in what is now the comune of Panguipulli.

column1: It was not until 1946 that the city was officially founded. In 1903 the Capuchin order established a mission in Panguipulli. The Capuchin monks built the first schools in the area. In 1947 the Capuchin built Panguipulli's twin towered wooden church
column2: which is now a local landmark.

column1: Most of the tourists that visit the Panguipulli area are drawn by a desire to commune with nature. The municipality uses the nearby Seven Lakes prominently in its tourist promotions. Some nearby tourist attractions include; the hot springs at Liquiñe
column4: which features year-round skiing. Rafting and wild boar hunting are also popular activities in the region.

column1: Panguipulli is linked to San Martín de los Andes in Argentina by the Hua-Hum international pass. It is one of the few passes between Chile and Argentina that is open all year round. The international way follows a geologic fault
column2: which has created a depression now filled by Pirihueico Lake. To get from one side of Pirihueico Lake to the other
column4: nearly half an hour by car east of Panguipulli
column5: operates a ferry that crosses the lake twice a day.

column1: The commune of Panguipulli is characterized by an Alpine landscape shaped by Quaternary glaciers and recent volcanism. Two morphological zones can be found in here
column2: the Precordillera and the Andes. The Precodillera zone covers most of western Panguipulli and has forest-covered hills dissected by big thoughts occupied by the glacial lakes of Calafquén
column3: Panguipulli and Riñihue. The first two are moraine-dammed and drain westward to Riñihue Lake.

column2: Panguipulli is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years.Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column4: Panguipulli is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by Mr. Enrique Jaramillo  (PDC) and Mr. Gastón Von Mühlenbrock (UDI) as part of the 54th electoral district
column9: La Unión and Paillaco). The commune is represented in the Senate by Andrés Allamand Zavala (RN) and Eduardo Frei Ruiz -Tagle (PDC) as part of the 16th senatorial constituency (Los Ríos Region).
